derivation: or מִנִּי; or מִנֵּי; (constructive plural) (Isaiah 30:11); for H4482 (מֵן);
outline:
1. from, out of, on account of, off, on the side of, since, above, than, so that not, more than
    1. from (expressing separation), off, on the side of
    2. out of
      1. (with verbs of proceeding, removing, expelling)
      2. (of material from which something is made)
      3. (of source or origin)
    3. out of, some of, from (partitively)
    4. from, since, after (of time)
    5. than, more than (in comparison)
    6. from...even to, both...and, either...or
    7. than, more than, too much for (in comparisons)
    8. from, on account of, through, because (with infinitive)
  2. that
kjv_def: above, after, among, at, because of, by (reason of), from (among), in, [idiom] neither, [idiom] nor, (out) of, over, since, [idiom] then, through, [idiom] whether, with.
strongs_def: properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
